intro: Dianthera hochstetteri, commonly known as the Hochstetter's dianthera, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slight aromatic scent. Dianthera hochstetteri is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
